I received my B.Sc. and M.Sc. degrees in Computer Science and Engineering from Sabanci University. In my master’s thesis, I implemented a data-driven intrusion detection system for 6LoWPAN based IoT systems under the supervision of Prof. Albert Levi.
I have recently worked as a Research Intern at Purdue University under the supervision of Dr. Z. Berkay Celik. The aim of the internship was to develop security solutions for IoT systems. We implemented a secure and robust context-based sensor pairing scheme in the smart home context.
In Fall 2022, I will join Purdue University, Department of Computer Science for pursuing my PhD.
My research interests include IoT/CPS security and privacy, wireless network security, systems security, the privacy of machine learning applications, and adversarial machine learning.
